waddington.kai.main.knnf

Class NetworkHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • waddington.kai.main.knnf.NetworkHelper

  • public class NetworkHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Static utilities class that contains mostly mathematics operations.

        Calculates the output size (therefore number of neurons) of a flattening layer.
        Parameters:
        inputSize - The size/shape of the input to the flattening layer.
        Returns:
        An int[] containing the output dimensions in the order: {z,y,x}

      • calculateConvolutionOutputSize

        public static int calculateConvolutionOutputSize(int filterSize,
                                                 int stride,
                                                 int inputSize)
        Used to calculate the size of a single dimension of the output of a convolution layer.
        Parameters:
        filterSize - The size of the filter used.
        stride - The stride used.
        inputSize - The input dimension along the axis that is to be calculated.
        Returns:
        An int of the size of the output along the dimension that is to be calculated.

      • calculateConvolutionOutputSize

        public static int[] calculateConvolutionOutputSize(int numberOfFilters,
                                                   int filterSize,
                                                   int stride,
                                                   int[] inputSize)
        Used to calculate the output shape/size from a convolution layer given its' input details.
        Parameters:
        numberOfFilters - The number of filters in the convolution layer.
        filterSize - The size of the filters in the convolution layer.
        stride - The stride that the convolution layer uses.
        inputSize - The [x,y] size of the input to the convolution layer.
        Returns:
        An int[] containing the output dimensions in the order: {z,y,x}

      • calculatePoolOutputSize

        public static int calculatePoolOutputSize(int poolSize,
                                          int stride,
                                          int inputSize)
        Used to calculate the size of a single dimension of the output of a pooling layer.
        Parameters:
        poolSize - The size of the receptive field of the pooling layer.
        stride - The stride used.
        inputSize - The input dimension along the axis that is to be calculated.
        Returns:
        An int of the size of the output along the dimension that is to be calculated.

      • calculatePoolOutputSize

        public static int[] calculatePoolOutputSize(int poolSize,
                                            int stride,
                                            int[] inputSize)
        Used to calculate the output shape/size from a pooling layer.
        Parameters:
        poolSize - The size of the receptive field of the pooling layer.
        stride - The stride used.
        inputSize - The [x,y] size of the input to the pool layer.
        Returns:
        An int[] containing the output dimensions in the order: {z,y,x}

      • createLayerOrderMap

        public static java.util.Map<LayerType,LayerOrder> createLayerOrderMap()
        Uses LayerOrder instances to set up a data structure used to check that layers are in a valid order.
        Returns:
        A Map between all LayerType's and their LayerOrder instances.

      • createSubMatrix

        public static org.jblas.DoubleMatrix createSubMatrix(org.jblas.DoubleMatrix input,
                                                     int startY,
                                                     int startX,
                                                     int sizeY,
                                                     int sizeX,
                                                     int stride)
        Creates a matrix from a portion of a provided matrix.

        Used by convolution and pooling layers to get their receptive fields during their operations.

        Parameters:
        input - The original DoubleMatrix.
        startY - The Y position that the sub-matrix should start from.
        startX - The X position that the sub-matrix should start from.
        sizeY - The Y size of the sub-matrix.
        sizeX - The X size of the sub-matrix.
        stride - The stride used by the calling layer type.
        Returns:
        A DoubleMatrix containing the sub-matrix requested.

      • getErrorFromConv

        public static org.jblas.DoubleMatrix getErrorFromConv(Neuron neuron,
                                                      java.util.List<Neuron> lowerNeurons,
                                                      java.util.List<Neuron> upperNeurons)
        Gets the backpropagated error from a convolution layer.
        Parameters:
        neuron - The neuron calling this method.
        lowerNeurons - A list containing references to the neurons in the layer below.
        upperNeurons - A list containing references to the neurons in the layer above.
        Returns:
        A DoubleMatrix containing the backpropagated error from a convolution layer.

      • getErrorFromFlatten

        public static org.jblas.DoubleMatrix getErrorFromFlatten(java.util.List<Neuron> upperNeurons,
                                                         int id,
                                                         int rows,
                                                         int cols)
        Gets the backpropagated error from a flatten layer.
        Parameters:
        upperNeurons - The list of neurons in the layer above.
        id - The ID of the current neuron.
        rows - The rows in the input data. Used to shape the output of this function.
        cols - The columns in the input data. Used to shape the output of this function.
        Returns:
        A DoubleMatrix containing the backpropagated error from a flattening layer.

      • getErrorFromPool

        public static org.jblas.DoubleMatrix getErrorFromPool(java.util.List<Neuron> upperNeurons,
                                                      int id)
        Gets the backpropagated error from a pooling layer.
        Parameters:
        upperNeurons - A list containing references to the neurons in the layer above.
        id - The ID of the neuron calling this function.
        Returns:
        A DoubleMatrix containing the backpropagated error from a pooling layer.

      • getUpperError

        public static org.jblas.DoubleMatrix getUpperError(Neuron neuron,
                                                   java.util.List<Neuron> lowerNeurons,
                                                   java.util.List<Neuron> upperNeurons)
        Gets a DoubleMatrix containing the backpropagated error from a list of neurons.

        Works if the type of the layer above is flatten/conv/pool.

        Parameters:
        neuron - The neuron that is calling this method.
        lowerNeurons - A list of neurons in the layer below.
        upperNeurons - A list of neurons in the layer above.
        Returns:
        A DoubleMatrix containing the backpropagated error from the layer above.

        Joins the data from a List of Neurons into a single flat list.
        Parameters:
        inputNeurons - The List of Neurons that data should be joined from.
        Returns:
        A DoubleMatrix containing the data from all of the neurons.

      • matchActivation

        public static LayerActivation matchActivation(java.lang.String activation)
        Takes a string and matches it to a LayerActivation activation type.
        Parameters:
        activation - The string that the user specifies as the activation type.
        Returns:
        A LayerActivation type that matches the specified string.
        Throws:
        waddington.kai.main.knnf.exceptions.UnknownActivationTypeException - if passed String cannot be matched to a LayerActivation.

      • matchPoolType

        Takes a string and matches it to a LayerType pool type.
        Parameters:
        poolType - The string that the user specifies as the pool type.
        Returns:
        A LayerType type that matches the specified string.
        Throws:
        waddington.kai.main.knnf.exceptions.UnknownPoolTypeException - if passed String cannot be matched to a LayerType.

      • poolDecodeLocation

        public static int[] poolDecodeLocation(int encodedValue,
                                       int inputRows)
        Decodes an encoded cell location.
        Parameters:
        encodedValue - The encoded cell location generated from the poolEncodeLocation(int, int, int, int) method.
        inputRows - The number of rows in the matrix that the cell belongs to.
        Returns:
        The {Y, X} locations that the cell references.

      • poolEncodeLocation

        public static int poolEncodeLocation(int y,
                                     int x,
                                     int inputRows,
                                     int inputCols)
        Encodes a cells location in a matrix as a number.

        The number of rows and columns is required because the X and Y cell locations are zero-padded to be the length of the number of digits in the number of rows/cols. This allows for the splitting of the number in the correct location to separate the X and Y locations. The resulting number begins and ends with a 1 to preserve the zeros from the padding.

        Parameters:
        y - The Y location of the cell.
        x - The X location of the cell.
        inputRows - The number of rows in the matrix that the cell is in.
        inputCols - The number of columns in the matrix that the cell is in.
        Returns:
        An encoded version of the cells location.

      • relu

        public static double relu(double value,
                          double leakRate)
        The ReLu (and Leaky ReLu) function.

        The ReLu function is the same as the Leaky ReLu function just with a leak rate of 0.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to apply the ReLu function to.
        leakRate - The leak rate.
        Returns:
        The new value.
